intro: Osbeckia homblei, commonly known as the Hombli's willow herb, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features narrow, hairy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Osbeckia homblei is adapted to harsh, cold environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a component of high-altitude ecosystems and its potential for medicinal use.
